CHAT.comment: Conversation in Mariposa and her sister Tia at their home in western Chubut, Argentina
Fraibet Aveledo, Lowri Jones and Jonathan Stammers, Bangor University

Language markers: @s:cym = Welsh, @s:eng = English, @s:cym&spa = Undetermined, @s:spa+cym = word with first morpheme(s) Spanish, second morpheme(s) Welsh, @s:cym+spa = word with first morpheme(s) Welsh, second morpheme(s) Spanish. Untagged words are Spanish except where part of an utterance headed [- cym], in which untagged words are Welsh.

u.a: it's too damp to go out today
it's too wet to go out today after that heavy rain yesterday
to sort out up the flowers and things
they can't cut the grass or anything
we wouldn't have to do anything but talk
but when you know that the recorder is there, switched on
you can't think of a single word
it doesn't come to your mind
you don't know what to say
as far as I'm concerned, I'd perfer it if they asked us things
uh, what they are interested in
what they want one to say
and as one knows that the recorder is on
it seems that one can't think of anything
I will have to fix it
how many Welsh people [...] are there now?
that's seven that are at Jenny's [?]
the other gentleman who came here with Luis
seven people are staying at her house
Jenny is good at looking after them
Jenny is good at looking after people who come from other places because she can...
taking them and sorting out everything they need
we've gotten a little bit old now
we've gotten old for doing this recording work
and I can't remember a lot of things
we try to do our best
we try to do our best to help anything if we can
but our memory is starting to go
but then we've hardly been outside
so that we have no, um...
I hope it won't rain today, and then...
if the Welsh people are leaving today...
if the Welsh people are leaving today, they'll be going now at midday, surely, to the...
well, have they been in the Valley?
they'll have to, at something like three
oh, they'll be going to Bariloche now, I'm sure
it was from the Eisteddfod that they came here
they came to the Valley for the Eisteddfod
they've been in Esquel for a week
they've been in Esquel for a week
so they arrived in Esquel last Tuesday
they've been in the valley a bit, I'm sure
well, I've got nothing else to say
Bangor, where Jonathan Roberts used to live
and I think it was near Bangor where he lived
so that there were always people in the chapel on Sunday nights
there were many people from away
I guess some of them had come from Trevelin as well
[...] the chapel of Trevelin often come to Esquel
well there they don't have anything
what a shame because the chapel of Trevelin is so nice
and so there are no more...
the old people who used to go to the chapel...
and here not many are left either
look how many are missing from our chapel
Martin Jones, Harry Thomas, David, Fiona...
Myfyr doesn't go out to the chapel any more either
there only a few are left who can go to the chapel
but those who want to go, that's fine
but there's only four or five of them
[...] and María and all those had rather not have anything to do with the chapel.
we have to put the meat in the oven for it to roast
I'll have to put the meat in the oven for it to roast
well, if you don't you won't have by two o'clock.
I don't know what is going to happen today
I don't know what is going to...
[...] has to be at his work
and they need to start at seven in the morning, don't they?
and when he leaves at three in the afternoon [...] seven in the morning, and when he leaves at five, he goes in at ten in the morning.
is the clock ours or theirs?
such a shame that the peonies drop their petals so quickly, isn't it?
it cost me [...] to fill the vase [check]
you just need to touch them like this and they fall off
and with all this rain as well
what a pity because they look so pretty like that
I tried to find those that were closed the most
those that were closed the most
they last so little, don't they?
in the vase, when there is central heating, they don't last either
and what is going to flower next now, after the peonies?
the white peonies are going to flower
Alberta said that she had a bush that was full of lilac flowers
and they were left all black, you see
so she doesn't have many flowers
but here there are few flowers as well
now the peonies drop their petals
yesterday it rained in Bariloche as well
well, and she said that the garden was beautiful
I would like to go to Bariloche to
they have been living in Bariloche for such a long time, and one doesn't...
I haven't been to visit them
I would have liked to go and see her house
but what a coincidence that I told you that it was a long time that we hadn't heard anything from Alberta
and in the evening she rings
that it had been long since we had heard from Alberta
sure, and straight afterwards she rang
and in the evening she rang
and I don't know what else we can say
Ann is going to come back soon [...]
she says that next week perhaps she will be ready to come
they have the results of all the tests that the doctors have been doing on her
in which year did we go...
how many year have we lived...?
I was sixty-five when we came to live in the village
and she had been born in Bella Vista
we lived in the same house for sixty-five years
because I don't remember when we were living in...
I would have been very little
and I grew up in the same house for sixty-five years
until we came to the village to live
already twenty years have passed since we have been in this house
was it the fifth of May?
because now we wouldn't be able to stay there in the countryside
and now that Jamie isn't there any more
we would be sitting in the house
we would have to walk to the village
thank god we are here in the village, we are close
many people come to see us and everything
because in the countryside to look just for us, it is very far
[...] to say that we don't have any more...
that don't have any more things to chat about
look, the sun is coming out now
and the sky is really, really blue
this morning there was no trace of rain
but the paths and so on were all dry
I believe that as there wasn't any rain without wind, the paths didn't get washed
TIA made a noise of negation with her lips.
the thing is that it was very dirty on the path here at the front
ah, the one at the front as well?
but I'd say the one that is alongside the wall
it didn't get washed at all
what are we going to do?
well, I don't know who might be coming to see us today
I don't know who might be coming to see us today
Tuesday today, Tuesday, the 17th of November
November is passing by already, isn't it?
Alberta said that the 19th of November is the mother's/matron's birthday
today I'll go and look for the booklet
I don't know where I've put it
there, if it's there at the back
um, yes, 19th November didn't she say
I don't know what date was his birthday
I think that Alberta is missing her parents a lot, isn't she?
and look, she's on her own all week
but when she is there in the house she must miss her parents
thank god she likes doing the garden and things like that
but she also works at teh office, doesn't she?
yes, yes, she gives English lessons
she gives them at the centre, I don't know where
she says that her husband comes every weekend
that her husbands travels evry weekend
and she is doting at her grandchildren
uh, what is the eldest daughter called, Carolina.
she has two gorgeous little boys she says
doesn't she have a two-year-old girl?
and the other one is very little
and the other one, Olga, has a boyfriend
and I think she said that she was already five
she said she was four or five years old
and the son has a girl of about six years
it'd be lovely to see them
I wonder how long it will be
I can't move because I have this thing attached here
you have to go and put the...
and put the meat in the oven
we haven't opened the blinds of the [...] outside
I wanted to clean this window [...]
I would like to lift it this year
wipe the feather duster over it
now [..] it wouldn't be too late in the day
lucky that it rained because we needed it
the plants, the flowerbeds were all dry
but they wouldn't have to have been soaked that much
we neded a good rain like the one yesterday
hopefully if they now go [...] to Buenos Aires
hopefully Elva has told Llinos if they make it a meeting
then Llinos [...] and will be able to go
to see if she knows Llinos
surely they'll tell everybody who is Welsh
so that they come to the meeting
yes, we have spoken more Spanish than Welsh
and that's what we're used to
she said it didn't matter what we talked about
that we are going to do it
will many people have been to the chapel yesterday?
Mariela went to see Morela yesterday
she had said that she'd go and visit Anna as well, but...
no, no, hse had been, says Anna
and Anna is a little bit outside the circle
she has said she's coming here [...], Anna
but she had said to Beryl Glyn that she's coming to look for me
with Anna they could've talked quite a bit in Welsh
and she had gone yesterday, had gone with Jenny
she had gone to see her and Enlli as well
hey next week I'll go and visit Enlli
if I manage to find her before...
ah, but if you're going to go and see Enlli you have to warn her
first so that she doesn't go to bed
you saw how the floor was shining
as if she had washed it yesterday
and wiped it with a cloth afterwards
washed it nicely with lavender and so on
and wiped it with a woollen cloth afterwards
so that it would be all spick and span
and with what are you going to clean it?
I'll pick it up from that thing
but no, only a little bit is hanging out
I've put a new piece on
and I [...] couldn't change the cloth
but who will do it for you now
if the upholsterer will do it
uh, this chat takes a long time
maybe that girls has gone to sleep in the dining room?
she must be asleep in the dining room
I'll go and have a look
